formula: Conjecture: S(n) = sum(k=1, n, a(k) ) is asymptotic to C*n*log(n) with C=0.29...... - _Benoit Cloitre_, Aug 11 2002Comment from _Giorgio Balzarotti_, Sep 18 2005: by means of the Prime Number Theorem is possible to derive the following inequality : c1*n*log(n) < S(n)< c2*n*log(n), where log is the natural logarithm and c1 = 1/4 and c2 = 3/8 (for n > 130). For a more accurate estimation of the values for c1 and c2, it necessary to know the number of twin primes with respect to the total number of primes.
maple: A051699 := proc(n) if isprime(n) then 0; elif n<= 2 then 2-n ; else min(nextprime(n)-n, n-prevprime(n)) ; end if ; end proc; # _R. J. Mathar_, Nov 01 2009
